Docs.summary: Given a parallel cursor set, this consolidates them into a single cursor. The batchSize is a hint used for efficiency.

Docs.summary: From the given input cursor, split it into a cursor set with the given cardinality. If not all the active columns are cachable, this will only produce the given input cursor.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int GetThreadCount (Microsoft.ML.IHost host, int num = 0, bool preferOne = false);
.method public static hidebysig int32 GetThreadCount(class Microsoft.ML.IHost host, int32 num, bool preferOne) cil managed
Public Function GetThreadCount (host As IHost, Optional num As Integer = 0, Optional preferOne As Boolean = false) As Integer
static member GetThreadCount : Microsoft.ML.IHost * int * bool -> int

Docs.summary: Get the target number of threads to use, given a host and another indicator of thread count. When num > 0, this uses num limited to twice what the host says. Otherwise, if preferOne is true, it returns 1. Otherwise, it returns what the host says.

Docs.summary: Tests whether the cursors are mutually compatible for consolidation, that is, they all are non-null, have the same schemas, and the same set of columns are active.

Docs.summary: Try to create a cursor set from upstream and consolidate it here. The host determines the target cardinality of the cursor set.
